newsitem.title: USA: Typhoon threatens Pacific shipping, Japan.
newsitem.headline: Typhoon threatens Pacific shipping, Japan.

text.p: Typhoon Opal is becoming an increasing threat to shipping in the western Pacific as it tracks towards Japan, independent forecaster Weather Services Corp (WSC) said on Tuesday.
Opal has winds of 100 mph and is located east of the northern Philippines and about 600 miles south-southeast of Okinawa.
It is expected to have winds up to 130 mph in 24-48 hours as it tracks east of Okinawa and towards Shikoku, Japan.

It is expected to reach Shikoku in about 60 hours with winds of 115-120 mph. Should this track hold, the island would experience very heavy rains leading to flooding and possible mudslides, WSC added.
